{{../doc}} {{divhide|Staging area}} ==Images== Use only ONE image at a time File:Alcatraz Island.jpg|Alcatraz Island File:Flag of Namibia.svg|Flag of Namibia File:Coat of Arms of Namibia.svg|Coat of Arms of Namibia File:Namibia.SamNujoma.01.jpg|President Sam Nujoma of Namibia File:Jacques-Louis David 018.jpg|Pope Pius VII File:BenitoJuarez.jpg|President Benito Juárez of Mexico File:Tcranmer.JPG|Archbishop Thomas Cranmer File:Thai 4 Buddies.jpg|Four-faced Phra Phrom statue, Erawan Shrine, Bangkok File:Bundesarchiv Bild 146-1976-130-51, Rudolf-Christoph v. Gersdorff.jpg|Rudolf Christoph von Gersdorff ==Ineligible== {|class="wikitable" |- !Blurb !Reason |- | '''[[Benito Juárez|Benito Juárez Day]]''' in [[Fiestas Patrias (Mexico)|Mexico]]; | refimprove |- | '''[[World Poetry Day]]''' | stub |- | [[1801]] – The '''[[Battle of Alexandria]]''' was fought between British and French forces near the ruins of [[Nicopolis]] in Egypt. |{{tl|more footnotes}} |- | [[1804]] – The '''''[[Napoleonic Code]]''''', the French [[civil code]] established under [[Napoleon]], entered into force, eventually strongly influencing the law of many other countries. |unreferenced section, refimprove section |- | [[1943]] – [[World War II]]: [[Wehrmacht]] officer '''[[Rudolf Christoph Freiherr von Gersdorff|Rudolf Christoph von Gersdorff]]''' attempted to assassinate [[Adolf Hitler]] by [[suicide bombing]], but had to abort the plan at the last minute. | refimprove |- | [[1960]] – Police in [[Sharpeville, Gauteng|Sharpeville]], South Africa, '''[[Sharpeville massacre|opened fire]]''' on a group of unarmed black demonstrators who were protesting [[pass laws]], killing almost 70 people and wounding about 180 others. |Tagged with {{tl|expand}} |- | [[1968]] – [[War of Attrition]]: The [[Israel Defense Forces]] clashed with the combined forces of the [[Palestine Liberation Organization]] and the [[Jordanian Army]] in the '''[[Battle of Karameh]]'''. | neutrality issues |- | [[1980]] – The United States announced the '''[[1980 Summer Olympics boycott|boycott]]''' of the [[1980 Summer Olympics|Summer Olympics]] in [[Moscow]] to protest the [[Soviet war in Afghanistan|Soviet invasion of Afghanistan]]. |date not in article, refimprove section |} ==Eligible== {{*mp}} [[1909]] – The remains of the '''[[Báb]]''', one of three central figures of the [[Bahá'í Faith]], were interred by [[`Abdu'l-Bahá]] in [[Haifa]], present-day Israe]. {{*mp}} [[1913]] – Over 360 were killed and 20,000 homes destroyed in the '''[[Great Dayton Flood]]''' in [[Dayton, Ohio]]. {{*mp}} [[1937]] – A police squad, acting under orders from [[Governor of Puerto Rico]] [[Blanton Winship]], '''[[Ponce massacre|opened fire]]''' on demonstrators protesting the arrest of [[Puerto Rican Nationalist Party|Puerto Rican Nationalist]] leader [[Pedro Albizu Campos]], killing 17 people and injuring over 200 others. {{*mp}} [[1946]] – The [[St. Louis Rams#Los Angeles Rams (1946–1994)|Los Angeles Rams]] of the [[National Football League]] signed '''[[Kenny Washington (American football)|Kenny Washington]]''', making him the first [[African American]] player in the league since 1933. {{*mp}} [[1963]] – The [[List of U.S. federal prisons|U.S. federal prison]] on '''[[Alcatraz Island]]''' in [[San Francisco Bay]], [[California]], was closed. {{*mp}} [[2002]] – British schoolgirl '''[[Murder of Milly Dowler|Amanda Dowler]]''' was abducted on her way home from [[Heathside School]] in [[Walton-on-Thames]], [[Surrey]]. {{divhide|end}} '''[[March 21]]''': '''[[World Down Syndrome Day]]'''; '''[[Bahá'í Naw-Rúz|Naw-Rúz]]''' ([[Bahá'í calendar]]); '''[[Mother's Day]]''' in the [[Arab world]]; [[List of national independence days|Independence Day]] in '''[[Namibia]]''' ([[1990]])
[[File:Thomas-Cranmer-ez cropped.jpg|Archbishop Thomas Cranmer|100x100px]]
{{*mp}} [[630]] – [[Byzantine Empire|Byzantine]] emperor [[Heraclius]] restored the '''[[True Cross]]''' to [[Jerusalem]]. {{*mp}} [[1556]] – [[Archbishop of Canterbury]] '''[[Thomas Cranmer]]''' ''(pictured)'', one of the founders of [[Anglicanism]], was [[Execution by burning|burnt at the stake]] in [[Oxford]], England, for [[Christian heresy|heresy]]. {{*mp}} [[1800]] – After [[Papal conclave, 1799–1800|being elected]] as a compromise candidate after several months of stalemate, '''[[Pope Pius VII|Pius VII]]''' was [[Papal Coronation|crowned e]] in [[Venice]] with a [[Papier-mâché Tiara|temporary papal tiara]] made of [[papier-mâché]]. {{*mp}} [[1871]] – Founder of the [[German Empire]] '''[[Otto von Bismarck]]''' was proclaimed as its first [[Chancellor of the German Empire|Chancellor]]. {{*mp}} [[1989]] – An article in ''[[Sports Illustrated]]'' alleged that '''[[Pete Rose]]''', the [[Manager (baseball)|manager]] of the [[Major League Baseball]] team [[Cincinnati Reds]], was involved in [[gambling]]. {{*mp}} [[2006]] – A man using a hammer smashed the statue of [[Phra Phrom]] in the '''[[Erawan Shrine]]''' in [[Bangkok]], Thailand, and was subsequently beaten to death by bystanders. {{SelAnnivFooter|Month=March|Day=21}} [[af:Wikipedia:Uitgesoekte herdenkings/21 Maart]] [[ast:Plantía:Efemérides - 21 marzu]] [[az:Vikipediya:Tarixdə bu gün/mart 21]] [[bs:Šablon:Na današnji dan/21. mart]] [[bg:Шаблон:Начална страница 21 март]] [[ca:Plantilla:Març 21]] [[cs:Wikipedie:Vybraná výročí dne/21. březen]] [[da:Wikipedia:Årets dage kort/21. marts]] [[de:Wikipedia:Hauptseite/Jahrestage/März/21]] [[el:Πύλη:Κύρια/Επιλεγμένα Γεγονότα/21 Μαρτίου]] [[es:Plantilla:Efemérides - 21 de marzo]] [[eu:Txantiloi:Martxoa 21]] [[fa:ویکی‌پدیا:یادبودهای برگزیده/۲۱ مارس]] [[ga:Vicipéid:Laethanta roghnaithe/21 Márta]] [[gl:Wikipedia:Efemérides destacadas/21 de marzo]] [[gan:Wikipedia:許年今日/三月二十一號]] [[ko:위키백과:오늘의 역사/3월 21일]] [[hr:Wikipedija:Izabrane godišnjice/21. ožujka]] [[he:תבנית:היום בהיסטוריה 21 במרץ]] [[ka:თარგი:დღის მოვლენები:03-21]] [[lt:Šablonas:Kovo 21 dienos įvykiai]] [[ms:Wikipedia:Hari ulang tahun pilihan/21 Mac]] [[nl:Sjabloon:Geschiedenis 21 maart]] [[no:Mal:Mars 21]] [[pl:Szablon:Rocznice 21 marca]] [[pt:Wikipédia:Efemérides/21 de março]] [[ro:Format:Aniversările zilei/21 martie]] [[ru:Шаблон:События дня:03-21]] [[sl:Wikipedija:Izbrane obletnice/21. marec]] [[sr:Шаблон:Догодило се на данашњи дан/21. март]] [[fi:Malline:21. maaliskuuta]] [[sv:Mall:21 mars]] [[ta:விக்கிப்பீடியா:ஆண்டு நிறைவுகள்/மார்ச் 21]] [[tt:Үрнәк:21/3 könenä küzätü]] [[th:วิกิพีเดีย:วันนี้ในอดีต/21 มีนาคม]] [[tr:Vikipedi:Tarihte bugün/21 Mart]] [[uk:Вікіпедія:Проект:Цей день в історії/21 березня]] [[zh-yue:Wikipedia:當年今日/3月21號]] [[zh:Wikipedia:历史上的今天/3月21日]]

[[File:Nuffield College tower.jpg|100px|Nuffield College Tower]]
The '''[[Buildings of Nuffield College, Oxford|buildings of Nuffield College]]''', one of the [[colleges of the University of Oxford]], are to the west of the city centre of [[Oxford]], England, on the former site of the largely disused basin of the [[Oxford Canal]]. [[Nuffield College, Oxford|Nuffield College]] was founded in 1937 after a donation to [[University of Oxford|the university]] by the car manufacturer [[William Morris, 1st Viscount Nuffield|Lord Nuffield]]. He rejected the initial designs of the architect [[Austen Harrison]], which were heavily influenced by Mediterranean architecture, describing them as "un-English". Harrison then aimed for "something on the lines of Cotswold domestic architecture", as Nuffield wanted. The college was built to the revised plans between 1949 and 1960. During construction, the tower, about {{convert|150|ft}} tall, was redesigned to hold the college's library. Reaction to the architecture has been largely unfavourable. It has been described as "Oxford's biggest monument to barren reaction" and "a hodge-podge from the start". However, the architectural historian [[Nikolaus Pevsner|Sir Nikolaus Pevsner]] thought that the tower helped the Oxford skyline and predicted that it would "one day be loved". The writer [[Simon Jenkins]] doubted Pevsner's prediction, though, saying that "vegetation" was the "best hope" for the tower, and for the rest of the college too. ('''[[Buildings of Nuffield College, Oxford|more...]]''') Recently featured: [[Tom Derrick]] – [[Tom Swift]] – "[[Abyssinia, Henry]]" {{TFAfooter|Month=March|Year=2012}}

<noinclude><!-- --============================================================ -- Display a number, with optional fraction part: 6+3/8 --============================================================ -- (see NOTES at bottom) -- --></noinclude>{{#if:{{#titleparts:{{{1|-1200-3~118}}}|1|2}} |{{Convert/numdisp/frac |{{{1|-1200-3/118}}}|{{#titleparts:{{{1|-1200-3/118}}}|1|1}}|{{#titleparts:{{{1|-1200-3/118}}}|1|2}}}}<!--split at "/" --else-->|{{#ifexpr:{{{1|-14000.00}}} < 0 |<!--then re-build negative number (see NOTE Z4 below) -->{{formatnum: {{padright:−<!--&minus-->{{#expr:-{{{1|-14000.00}}} }}<!--endexpr --put decimal if needed-->{{ #ifexpr:{{{1|-14000.00}}}0={{{1|-14000.00}}} and {{{1|-14000.00}}}=floor( {{{1|-14000.00}}} )|.}}<!-- -->|{{strlen_short|{{{1|-14000.00}}}|}}<!--endstrlen_short -->|0}}<!--endpadright end-zeroes "0" to original length -->}}<!--endformatnum else-->|{{formatnum: {{{1|6000.500}}} }}}}<!--endif {1}<0 -->}}<noinclude><!--endif {#titleparts..} -------------------------------------------------------------- --NOTES: -- [ These comments are skipped by <noinclude> and not sent -- in formatted Internet pages, only during edit. ] -- --NOTE A1: This template processes a number, for display, by -- checking to display a fraction part ("/"), else it -- will check for negative to display a unicode &minus -- and {{formatnum:{{#expr:abs( {{{1|-6000}}} )}}}} such -- as "-6000" with a full minus sign rather than hyphen. -- In 99% of Wikipedia usage, there are no fractions. -- --NOTE D2: The check, for fraction parts, uses parser-function -- #titleparts to split the number at "/" (if any) and -- then checks part 2 (the denominator, after the slash) -- to trigger use of {{Convert/numdisp/fracparts}}. Hence, -- #if: {{#titleparts:{{{1|6+3/8}}}|1|2}} -- will be true if a denominator exists (such as "8"). -- --NOTE N3: This template uses minimal expansion depth of the -- if-else logic by checking for "/" before invoking the -- nested subtemplate {{Convert/numdisp/fracparts}}. The -- check for a negative number increases the nesting depth -- by 1 level to apply abs({1}) in a nested {#expr:} parser -- function, to use the absolute value of the amount {1}. -- --NOTE Z4: Any end-zeroes on a decimal are preserved by not -- using positive amounts in an expression, and for rare -- negative amounts, the &minus with inverse -{1} is padded -- by {padright:} with end-zeroes "0" to {strlen_short} but -- uses #ifexpr:{1}0={1} and floor({1})={1} to put ".". -- So, {strlen_short} keeps minimal expansion depth of +2. -- -- WARNING: *** DO NOT DELETE COMMENTS FROM THIS TEMPLATE *** -- Unless these comments are readily available, people -- might tinker with the coding (or rename templates), -- in hopes to clarify operation because these comments -- were not nearby to explain the issues. Having these -- comments only on a doc-page increases the danger of -- explanations no longer matching the current coding. -- UPDATE these comments to match changes to the template. -- UPDATE the HISTORY during major changes (not typos). -- -------------------------------------------------------------- --HISTORY: --03Apr09 Created by [[User:Jimp]] on English Wikipedia. --19Nov10 Invokes subtemplate only if has denominator (at "/"). --19Nov10 Put NOTES comments to explain template coding. --19Nov10 Put HISTORY comments to log major changes. --19Nov10 Put all parameters on 1 line to avoid newline "2^ /3" --20Nov10 Linked {Documentation} to hold any interwiki links. --12Feb11 Shows Unicode &minus ("−") for negative numbers. --17Feb11 Used {padright:} to re-add end-zeroes on negatives. --17Feb11 Used #ifexpr:{1}0={1} and floor({1})={1}, to put "." -- ** Add interwiki links to /doc subpage to avoid changes here ** -- -->{{Documentation}} </noinclude>

revision.comment: Bot automatically updating DYK template with hooks copied from [[Template:Did you know/Queue/1|queue 1]]
revision.text:
{{active editnotice}} {{pp-template}}
{{DYKbox}} '''Did you know''' mentions and links to ''new'' articles or articles expanded by a factor of five within the last five days. To propose a new fact for this template, '''make a suggestion''' on the [[Template talk:Did you know|talk page]]. To report an error, see [[Wikipedia:Main Page/Errors|Main Page errors]]. Admins: *Before updating please [[Wikipedia:Did you know#Pictures|protect the featured image]]. *After updating please [{{fullurl:Main Page|action=purge}} purge the cache of the Main Page] so that the updated version appears.
__NOTOC__ {{clear}} ==Next update== {{DYK-Refresh}} ==Current hooks== {| | ''From Wikipedia's [[Wikipedia:Recent additions|newest content]]:''
[[File:Victoria Fountain Old Steine Brighton.jpg|100x100px|Victoria Fountain at Old Steine Gardens]]
{{*mp}}... that Sir [[John Cordy Burrows]] is responsible for the Victoria Fountain ''(pictured)'' at the '''[[Old Steine Gardens]]'''? {{*mp}}... that the [[Chicago Housing Authority]]{{`s}} renovation of the '''[[Dearborn Homes]]''' housing project includes adding [[neo-Georgian]] [[Quoin (architecture)|quoin]]s and ball-topped [[gable]]s to the brick high-rises? {{*mp}}... that the German teleplay '''''[[Jeder stirbt für sich allein (1962 film)|Jeder stirbt für sich allein]]''''', about [[Otto and Elise Hampel]], who were executed by the Third Reich, was directed by [[Falk Harnack]], who lost several family members to Nazi executions? {{*mp}}... that the '''[[1879 Michigan Wolverines football team|1879 Michigan football team]]''' defeated [[Racine College]], 1–0, in the first intercollegiate football game in the school's history? {{*mp}}... that [[dormouse|dormice]] benefit from [[charcoal|charcoal burning]] at '''[[Croes Robert Wood]]''', near [[Monmouth]]? {{*mp}}... that '''''[[De Typhoon]]''''', a Dutch paper founded during [[World War II]] by the [[Dutch resistance]], merged in 1992 with '''[[De Zaanlander|a competing local paper]]''' that had collaborated with the Germans during the war? {{-}}
'''[[Wikipedia:Recent additions|Archive]]''' – '''[[Wikipedia:Your first article|Start a new article]]''' – '''[[Template talk:Did you know|Nominate an article]]'''
|{{DYKbox}} |} [[Category:Wikipedia Did you know]] [[Category:Wikipedia Did you know templates]] [[af:Sjabloon:Het u geweet]] [[da:Skabelon:Vidste du at...]] [[de:Vorlage:Hauptseite Schon gewusst]] [[dsb:Pśedłoga:Zajmnostki]] [[eo:Ŝablono:ĈefPaĝo/ĈuViSciasKe]] [[es:Plantilla:Sabías que]] [[fi:Malline:Tiesitkö, että...]] [[fr:Modèle:Le saviez-vous ?]] [[he:תבנית:הידעת?]] [[hsb:Předłoha:HS-Wěš zo]] [[lv:Veidne:Vai tu zināji]] [[nl:Sjabloon:Hoofdpagina - wist je dat]] [[pl:Szablon:Czy wiesz]] [[pt:Predefiniחדo:Sabia que]] [[ru:Шаблон:Знаете ли вы]] [[simple:Template:Did you know]] [[sk:Šablףna:Vedeli ste]] [[sv:Mall:Visste du att]] [[zh:Template:Dyk]]

revision.comment: move pictured item to top (same date)
revision.text:
{{In the news/image |image = Women's Super G at Whistler Creekside closeup cropped.jpg |size = 100x100px |title = Lindsey Vonn |link = Women's Super G at Whistler Creekside closeup.jpg |border = no |alt = Lindsey Vonn }} {{*mp|March 18}} [[Lindsey Vonn]] ''(pictured)'' and [[Marcel Hirscher]] win the '''[[2012 Alpine Skiing World Cup|Alpine Skiing World Cup]]'''. {{*mp|March 18}} '''[[George Tupou V]]''', the King of Tonga, dies in Hong Kong at the age of 63. {{*mp|March 18}} [[Joachim Gauck]] is '''[[German presidential election, 2012|elected]]''' [[President of Germany]]. {{*mp|March 17}} '''[[Pope Shenouda III of Alexandria|Pope Shenouda III]]''', the head of the [[Coptic Orthodox Church of Alexandria]], dies at the age of 88. {{*mp|March 16}} '''[[Sachin Tendulkar]]''' of India becomes the first cricketer to score [[List of international cricket centuries by Sachin Tendulkar|100 international cricket centuries]]. {{*mp|March 16}} [[Nicolae Timofti]] is '''[[Moldovan presidential election, 2011–2012|elected]]''' [[President of Moldova]].
'''[[2011–2012 Syrian uprising|Conflict in Syria]]''' – '''[[n:Main Page|Wikinews]]''' – '''{{#ifexist:Deaths in {{CURRENTYEAR}}|[[Deaths in {{CURRENTYEAR}}|Recent deaths]]|[[Deaths in {{#time:Y|-1 years}}|Recent deaths]]}}''' – '''[[Portal:Current events|More current events...]]'''

<!--
Please note - this template is shown on the Main Page, and any changes or screw-ups you make will appear there immediately. Make changes very carefully, and always use the Show Preview button to make sure your changes turn out properly.
To make this template appear on the Main Page, add *plaintext* (with wikimarkup etc) after this comment. Formatting is added in the Main Page code itself.
-->

revision.comment: includeonly & code arrangement; no real change

revision.text: <includeonly>{{#expr:{{{2|0}}}+( ( {{{1|0}}} )/10^{{{2|0}}}>=10)}}</includeonly><noinclude>The purpose of this subtemplate is to correct a rounding error caused by #expr.</noinclude>

*'''[[Wikipedia:Community portal|Community portal]]''' – Bulletin board, projects, resources and activities covering a wide range of Wikipedia areas. *'''[[Wikipedia:Help desk|Help desk]]''' – Ask questions about using Wikipedia. *'''[[Wikipedia:Local Embassy|Local embassy]]''' – For Wikipedia-related communication in languages other than English. *'''[[Wikipedia:Reference desk|Reference desk]]''' – Serving as virtual librarians, Wikipedia volunteers tackle your questions on a wide range of subjects. *'''[[Wikipedia:News|Site news]]''' – Announcements, updates, articles and press releases on Wikipedia and the Wikimedia Foundation. *'''[[Wikipedia:Village pump|Village pump]]''' – For discussions about Wikipedia itself, including areas for technical issues and policies. <noinclude> {{documentation}} </noinclude>

revision.comment: copy changes from other POTD version
moved [[Template:Precision/1b]] to [[Template:Precision/2010]]: descriptive name for the old thing
Protected Template:Sec link/relative url: match parent template ([edit=autoconfirmed] (indefinite) [move=sysop] (indefinite))
Chuck in some {{nowrap|}}s. Feel free to take some (most) out.
revision.text:
More anniversaries: {{nowrap|[[{{#time: F j |{{{Day|1}}} {{{Month|January}}} {{CURRENTYEAR}} -1 days}}]] –}} {{nowrap|'''[[{{#time: F j |{{{Day|1}}} {{{Month|January}}} {{CURRENTYEAR}} }}]]''' –}} {{nowrap|[[{{#time: F j |{{{Day|1}}} {{{Month|January}}} {{CURRENTYEAR}} +1 days}}]]}}
{{nowrap|'''[[Wikipedia:Selected anniversaries/{{{Month}}}|Archive]]''' –}} {{nowrap|'''[[mail:daily-article-l|By email]]''' –}} {{nowrap|'''[[List of historical anniversaries]]'''}}
It is now {{nowrap|{{CURRENTMONTHNAME}} {{CURRENTDAY}}, {{CURRENTYEAR}}}} ([[Coordinated Universal Time|UTC]]) – {{nowrap|[{{fullurl:{{FULLPAGENAME}}|action=purge}} Refresh this page]}}

'''[[Wikipedia:Today's featured article/{{{Month}}} {{{Year}}}|Archive]]''' – '''[[mail:daily-article-l|By email]]''' – '''[[Wikipedia:Featured articles|More featured articles...]]'''
[[Category:Wikipedia administration templates]]

revision.comment: per talk:Main Page, replacing external link with wikilink to [[wmf:Our projects]]. Please revert if there's some important reason to have an external link instead.
revision.text:
Wikipedia is hosted by the [[Wikimedia Foundation]], a non-profit organization that also hosts a range of other [[wmf:Our projects|projects]]:
[[File:Commons-logo-31px.png|31px|link=commons:|Commons]] '''[//commons.wikimedia.org/ Commons]'''
Free media repository 		[[File:Wikiquote-logo-51px.png|51px|link=q:|Wikiquote]] '''[//en.wikiquote.org/ Wikiquote]'''
Collection of quotations 		[[File:Wikiversity-logo-41px.png|41px|link=v:|Wikiversity]] '''[//en.wikiversity.org/ Wikiversity]'''
Free learning materials and activities
[[File:Wikibooks-logo-35px.png|35px|link=b:|Wikibooks]] '''[//en.wikibooks.org/ Wikibooks]'''
Free textbooks and manuals 		[[File:Wikisource-logo-35px.png|35px|link=s:|Wikisource]] '''[//en.wikisource.org/ Wikisource]'''
Free-content library 		[[File:Wiktionary-logo-51px.png|51px|link=wikt:|Wiktionary]] '''[//en.wiktionary.org/ Wiktionary]'''
Dictionary and thesaurus
[[File:Wikinews-logo-51px.png|51px|link=n:|Wikinews]] '''[//en.wikinews.org/ Wikinews]'''
Free-content news 		[[File:Wikispecies-logo-35px.png|35px|link=wikispecies:|Wikispecies]] '''[//species.wikimedia.org/ Wikispecies]'''
Directory of species 		[[File:Meta-logo-35px.png|35px|link=m:|Meta-Wiki]] '''[//meta.wikimedia.org/ Meta-Wiki]'''
Wikimedia project coordination
{{documentation}}

revision.comment: moved up Serbian Wikipedia to the "more than 150,000 articles" tier
revision.text:
{{#ifeq: {{FULLPAGENAME}} | Special:Statistics | | This Wikipedia is written in [[English language|English]]. Started in {{Start date|2001}}, it currently contains [[Special:Statistics|{{NUMBEROFARTICLES}}]] articles. }}Many other Wikipedias are available; some of the largest are listed below.
  • More than 700,000 articles: {{Wikipedia languages/core|de}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|es}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|fr}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|it}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|nl}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|ja}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|pl}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|pt}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|ru}}
  • More than 150,000 articles: {{Wikipedia languages/core|ar}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|id}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|ca}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|cs}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|da}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|eo}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|fa}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|ko}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|hu}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|no}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|ro}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|sr}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|fi}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|sv}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|vi}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|tr}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|uk}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|zh}}
  • More than 50,000 articles: {{Wikipedia languages/core|ms}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|bg}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|et}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|el}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|simple}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|eu}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|gl}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|he}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|hr}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|lt}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|nn}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|sk}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|sl}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|sh}}{{·}} {{Wikipedia languages/core|th}}
'''{{sec link auto|meta|List of Wikipedias|Complete list of Wikipedias}}'''

revision.comment: moved [[Template:Wikipedialang/core]] to [[Template:Wikipedia languages/core]]: per [[Template talk:Wikipedialang#Move request]]
Making this template substable (sorry, job queue): Would be very usable to generalize input to some user talk page templates. Tested.
